title: Quiz 4: Education & Organizations
topicName: Unit One: Professionalism and Trends in Nursing
description: Check your understanding of nursing educational levels, degrees, and professional bodies.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of professional nursing organizations like the ANA or NNA?

options.text: To guarantee high salaries for all nurses
To advocate for the profession and set standards of practice

questions.explanation: Professional organizations exist to advance the profession, set standards, and advocate for nurses. Licensure is done by regulatory boards/councils.

questions.question: Order the levels of nursing education from lowest to highest:
questions.explanation: The progression is Diploma -> Bachelor's -> Master's -> Doctorate.

questions.question: Which of the following are benefits of joining a professional nursing organization? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Membership offers networking, education, and political voice, but does not guarantee job promotions.
questions.hint: What helps your career growth and knowledge?

questions.question: State licensure ensures the public that the nurse has met the ___BLANK___ standards for safe practice.
questions.explanation: Licensure protects the public by ensuring entry-level nurses meet minimum competency standards.

questions.question: Review the table below. What is the difference between Licensure and Certification?

richContent.content:
Credential ACredential B
Mandatory to practiceVoluntary
Issued by State/GovtIssued by Prof. Org
Minimum CompetencyExpert/Specialized knowledge

questions.question: Based on the table, Credential B represents what term?
questions.explanation: Certification is voluntary and validates specialized knowledge (e.g., Critical Care Certified), whereas Licensure is mandatory.

questions.question: Match the term with its definition:

pairs.right: Approval of a Nursing School program

questions.explanation: Accreditation applies to schools; Licensure applies to individuals; Registration is the listing.

questions.question: Continuing Professional Development (CPD) is optional and not usually required for license renewal.
questions.explanation: In most jurisdictions, Continuing Professional Development (CPD) or CNE credits are mandatory for license renewal to ensure nurses stay current.
questions.hint: Does medical knowledge stay the same forever?

questions.question: Which educational trend is currently emphasized to improve patient outcomes?

options.text: Transitioning to PhD as entry level

questions.explanation: Integrating EBP into education is a major trend to ensure practice is based on scientific research.

questions.question: The exam that nursing graduates must pass to obtain their license in the USA is known as the ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: The NCLEX (National Council Licensure Examination) is the standard exam in the US, Canada, and Australia.

questions.question: What is the role of a Regulatory Body (Nursing Council)? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Discipline nurses who violate the act

questions.explanation: Councils protect the public, issue licenses, and discipline unsafe nurses. They do not set university fees.
questions.hint: They focus on safety and regulation.
